definition: to take unfair advantage of/to deceive/to cheat
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over

sentences.english: Nothing can beguile the old man.
sentences.chinese: 什么也欺骗不了这位老人。
但是，我们能够欺骗死亡吗？

sentences.english: She told him of his old mother's deceit.
sentences.chinese: 她向他诉说了母后的欺骗行为。

sentences.english: I would rather be scolded than cheat (others).
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿挨骂不愿欺骗人。

sentences.english: Others say only if they cheat, or abuse you.
sentences.chinese: 另外一些人说除非欺骗或者虐待，否则不离开。

sentences.english: The con man has used my name card to cheat people and customers.
sentences.chinese: 这个骗徒拿我的名片欺骗大众和消费者。

sentences.english: What a precious gift honesty is in the midst of so much dishonesty.
sentences.chinese: 在如此多的欺骗中，诚实时如此的难能可贵。

sentences.english: According to this verse, that opens us up to deception.
sentences.chinese: 根据这段经文，那会让我们自我欺骗。

sentences.english: Charges of political chicanery were brought against him.
sentences.chinese: 他被指控行驶政治欺骗手段。

sentences.english: You took my heart, Deceived me right from the start.
sentences.chinese: 你虏获了我的心，从开始就欺骗我。

sentences.english: Only a fool will believe your cajolery.
sentences.chinese: 只有傻瓜才会相信你那花言巧语的欺骗。

sentences.english: Li Wang's view, and deceiving, which cut off the feet of his left foot.
sentences.chinese: 厉王认为和氏是欺骗，因而刖了他的左脚。

sentences.english: He also was intrigued by promises of access to “unpublished” jobs.
sentences.chinese: 他也被能得到“潜在”的工作的许诺欺骗。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, occasionally his eyes trick him.
sentences.chinese: 不过，偶尔他的眼睛也会欺骗他。

sentences.english: He is a merchant, the balances of deceit are in his hand: he loveth to oppress.
sentences.chinese: 以法莲是商人，手里有诡诈的天平，爱行欺骗。

definition: variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
to make a fool out of/to fool/to dupe
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over
graceful words, flowery speech (idiom); elegant but insincere words/cheating wheedling/dishonest rhetoric
to entice/to lure/to scam/to hoodwink/to decoy
